identificationModule.briefTitle: Post Anesthesia Care Unit (PACU) Weighted Blanket Study
identificationModule.officialTitle: Effectiveness of Weighted Blankets to Decrease Emergence Agitation, Sedation, and Vascular Complications in a Pediatric Cardiac Post Anesthesia Care Unit Following Cardiac Catheterization

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
This study is being conducted to evaluate the safety and efficacy of weighted blankets to reduce agitation in patients in the post-procedural phase after cardiac catheterization and electrophysiology procedures in the post anesthesia care unit.

The study hypothesizes that compared to the traditional and current post-procedural strategy, weighted blanket use will reduce agitation and therefore lessen the need for additional sedation along with a reduction of post-procedure vascular complications.

interventions.name: Standard of Care
interventions.description: Following the participants procedure, standard of care will be given in the recovery area.

interventions.name: Weighted blanket
interventions.description: Following the participants procedure once in the recovery area, the nursing staff will place a weighted blanket on the participants. Different weighted blanket sizes will be used based on participants weight.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Average Richmond Agitation Sedation Scale (RASS) compared between the two groups
primaryOutcomes.description: Richmond Agitation Sedation Score is a validated and standardized scoring system ranging from negative 5 (unarousable sedation) to 0 (awake and calm) to 4 (combative).
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: up to 60 minutes (after arrived to PACU)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Analgesia administered in the recovery area
secondaryOutcomes.description: Number of medications (Midazolam, Ketamine, Propofol, Dexmedetomidine, Lorazepam, etc.) required during the recovery period following the procedure.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: up to 6 hours after arriving in the PACU

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence of vascular complications in the recovery area
secondaryOutcomes.description: This will include participants that have episodes of re-bleeding and hematomas.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: up to 6 hours after arriving in the PACU

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Safety measures assessed by vital sign parameters for absolute oxygen (O2 saturation)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Absolute oxygen (O2) saturation drop of 10 points or more from recovery area arrival baseline.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: up to 6 hours after arriving in the PACU

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Safety measures assessed by vital sign parameters for respiration rate
secondaryOutcomes.description: Respiration rate decreased 20% or more from recovery arrival baseline.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: up to 6 hours after arriving in the PACU

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Safety measures assessed by vital sign parameters for respiratory effort
secondaryOutcomes.description: Increased Respiratory Effort (retractions, labored, nasal flaring, etc.) as compared to recover area arrival baseline
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: up to 6 hours after arriving in the PACU

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients undergoing cardiac catheterization or electrophysiology procedure
* Post Procedure bedrest plan for greater than (\>)2 hours
* Duration of recovery planned for 11th floor cardiac PACU

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients less than (\<) 40 pounds (18 kilogram (kg))
* Patients \> 220 pounds (100 kg)
* Recovery anticipated to not be in our cardiac PACU
* Posttraumatic stress disorder
* Claustrophobia
* Uncontrolled seizure disorders
* Open heart surgery within 30 days
* Severe pulmonary hypertension
* Severe asthma
* Sleep apnea requiring continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP)
* Known diaphragm paresis
* Home vent/CPAP
* Restrictive lung disease (such as patients with scoliosis)
* Higher risk for upper respiratory airway occlusion (such as patients with Down Syndrome)
* Cast, brace or splint, fractures
* Degenerative muscular disorder (such as patients with cerebral palsy)
* Areas of impaired skin integrity
* Gastrostomy tube
* Percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy
* Tracheostomy
* Chest tube(s)
* PACU procedures required (within 1 hour post arrival): post operative (post op) echocardiogram, post op Xray, post op electrocardiogram
